TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi beforefieldinit ResXFileRef/Converter extends System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter

Docs.summary: Provides a type converter to convert data for a to and from a string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef.Converter> provides the object the <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef> refers to. For example, if the <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef> is "xplogo.bmp;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing", then calling the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method of the converter will return a <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap>, not a <xref:System.Resources.ResXFileRef>.
For more information about type converters, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2013/ayybcxe5(v=vs.120)).
> [!NOTE] > Typically, you do not directly create an instance of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ImageIndexConverter>. Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor>. For more information, see the examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
